required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Three-dimensional Ultrasonography Versus Hysteroscopy in Evaluation of Uterine Cavity in Infertile Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study Comparing Three-dimensional Ultrasonography Versus Hysteroscopy in Evaluation of Uterine Cavity in Infertile Women

brief_summary.textblock:
Hysteroscopy has now become a gold-standard technique carried out for uterine cavity assessment in infertile women. Apart from direct visualizing of the endometrium by the naked eye, pathologies missed by other modalities of investigation can be picked up and managed appropriately. Unfortunately, the procedure itself is not free from complications e.g. perforation, cervical laceration, bleeding, limited access in cases of cervical stenosis and considered as an invasive procedure.
Two-dimensional transvaginal ultrasonography (2D-TVS)and Three-dimensional TVS (3D-TVS) are non-invasive methods for evaluating the uterine cavity. The3D-TVS is superior to 2D-TVS in identifying uterine cavity abnormalities due to its ability to obtain a view of three different planes of the uterus, which could be used to locate the position of intracavitary pathology. Reports vary regarding the diagnostic accuracy of 3D-TVS that was reported to have 41.3-81.5% sensitivity and 94.6-98.7% specificity. So it became clear that 3D-TVS is a non-invasive and safe diagnostic tool for evaluation of the uterine cavity abnormalities but its sensitivity, specificity and accuracy still a matter of debate and warrants more evaluation.

primary_outcome.description: The diagnostic accuracy of 3D-TVS in comparison with hysteroscopy for evaluation of uterine cavity abnormalities in infertile women.

arm_group.description: The 3D-TVS will be done by an experienced gynecological sonographer. The uterine cavity will be assessed by obtaining a mid-coronal view. Then, hysteroscopy will be performed.

intervention.description: The 3D-TVS will be done by an experienced gynecological sonographer. The uterine cavity will be assessed by obtaining a mid-coronal view. Then hysteroscopy will be performed

study_pop.textblock: Infertile women (primary or secondary) aged between 18 and 40 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infertile women (primary or secondary)
- Age between 18 and 40 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- age<18 years andËƒ 40 years.
- pelvic inflammatory disease.
- .Active uterine bleeding

overall_official.last_name: Hatem Abu Hashim, MD. FRCOG. PhD

reference.citation: Ahmadi F, Rashidy Z, Haghighi H, Akhoond M, Niknejadi M, Hemat M, Shamsipour M. Uterine cavity assessment in infertile women: Sensitivity and specificity of three-dimensional Hysterosonography versus Hysteroscopy. Iran J Reprod Med. 2013 Dec;11(12):977-82.
